string-array.name: xbee_addressing_command_names
string-array.item: Maximum number of API transmission bytes

string-array.name: xbee_addressing_descriptions
string-array.item: Read-only parameter\n\nRead high 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.
Read-only parameter\n\nRead low 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.

Read-only parameter

Read the 16 bit Network Address for the modem.
0xFFFE means the device has not joined a PAN.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFFFFFFFF (Default: 0)

Set/read the upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address.
0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN.
0x0000000000000000 can be used to address the Pan Coordinator.
Set/read the lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address.\n0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address for the PAN. 0x0000000000000000 can be used to address the Pan Coordinator.

Range: 0x0 - 0x1E (Default: 0)

Set/read the maximum hops limit.
This limit sets the maximum number of broadcast hops (BH) and determines the unicast timeout (unicast timeout = (50 × NH) + 100). A unicast timeout of 1.6 seconds (NH=30) is enough time for the data and acknowledgment to traverse about 8 hops.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFF (Default: FF)

Set/read the transmission radius for broadcast data transmissions.
Set to 0 for maximum radius.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFF (Default: FF)

Set/read the time between aggregation route broadcast times.
An aggregation route broadcast creates a route on all devices in the network back to the device that sends the aggregation broadcast. Setting AR to 0xFF disables aggregation route broadcasting. Setting AR to 0 sends one broadcast.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFFFFFFFF (Default: 30000)

Set/read the device type identifier value.
This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

Range: 0x20 - 0xFF (Default: 3C)

Set/read Node Discovery backoff register.
This sets the maximum delay for Node Discovery responses to be sent (ND, DN).

Range: 0x0 - 0x3 (Default: 0)

Sets the node discovery options register. Options include : 
0x01 - Append DD value to end of node discovery
0x02 - Return devices own ND response first

Read-only parameter

Read the maximum number of bytes that can be sent in a single API tx request frame.
The maximum RF payload per unicast packet is limited to 66 bytes if security is enabled (EE) or 84 otherwise. Source routing and fragmentation, if used, may further reduce the maximum RF payload size. Broadcast RF packets allow 8 more bytes than unicast.
Range: 0x1 - 0x3F (Default: 3)\n\nSet/read threshold for the number of PAN ID conflict reports that must be received by the network manager within one minute to trigger a PAN ID change.

string-array.name: xbee_diagnostics_descriptions
string-array.item: Read-only parameter.\n\nRead modem firmware version number.
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead modem hardware version number.
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead Association status code to monitor association progress.
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead the RSSI of the last received packet or APS acknowledgment.

Read-only parameter.

Read the supply voltage of the module.
The %V measurement returns { 4 × (Vcc/4) } where (Vcc/4) is the measurement value from the 10-bit A/D read, and the (4×) multiple allows the application to use the same formula to convert %V into mV units as it would to convert any A/D reading to mV: mV = (%V) × (1200/1024). (1200mV is the A/D reference voltage.)
A %V response of 0x900 (2304 decimal) represents 2700mV, or 2.7V.
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead power compensation temperature sensor in units of Celsius degrees.

string-array.name: xbee_io_settings_descriptions
string-array.item:
Default: 1

Configure options for the AD0/DIO0 line of the module.
Options include :
 - Enabling commissioning button functionality
 - Analog to Digital converter
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 0

Configure options for the AD1/DIO1 line of the module.
Options include :
 - Analog to Digital converter
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 0

Configure options for the AD2/DIO2 line of the module.
Options include :
 - Analog to Digital converter
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 0

Configure options for the AD3/DIO3 line of the module.
Options include :
 - Analog to Digital converter
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 0

Configure options for the AD4/DIO4 line of the module.
Options include :
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 1

Configure options for the DIO5/Assoc line of the module.
Options include :
 - Associated LED indicator (blinkds when associated)
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 1

Configure options for the DIO10 line of the module.
Options include :
 - RSSI PWM Output
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 0

Configure options for the DIO11 line of the module.
Options include :
 - Digital Input and Output

Default: 0

Configure options for the DIO12 line of the module.
Options include :
 - Digital Input and Output

Range: 0x0 - 0x3FFF (Default: 1FFF)

Set/read bitfield to configure internal pullup resistors status for I/O lines.
1=internal pullup enabled, 0=no internal pullup.
Bitfield map :
(13)DIO7/CTS (12)DIO11 (11)DIO10/PWM0 (10)DIO12
(9)On/Sleep (8)Associate (7)DIN/Config (6)Sleep_Rq
(5)RTS (4)AD0/DIO0 (3)AD1/DIO1 (2)AD2/DIO2 (1)AD3/DIO3 (0)DIO4

Range: 0x0A - 0xFF (Default: 0)

Set/read the Associated LED blink rate.
This value determines the blink rate of the Associate/DIO5 pin if D5=1 and the module has started a netwrok.
Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

Range: 0x0 - 0xFF (Default: 28)

Set/read PWM timer register.
Set duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI line pin (P6). The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet or APS acknowledgment and is shut off when the timer expires.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFF (Default: 1)

Bit0 - Reserved
Bit1 - Reserved
Bit2 - 0/1 = First or Best Response
Bit3 - Reserved

Range: 0x32 - 0xFFFF (Default: 0)

Set the IO sampling rate to enable periodic sampling.
If set > 0, all enabled digital IO and analog inputs will be sampled and transmitted every IR milliseconds. IO Samples are transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFFFF (Default: 0)

Bitfield that configures which digital IO pins should be monitored for change detection.
If a change is detected on an enabled digital IO pin, a digital IO sample is immediately transmitted to the address specified by DH+DL.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFFFF (Default: 0)

Configure the supply voltage high threshold.
If the supply voltage measurement equals or drops below this threshold, the supply voltage will be appended to an IO sample transmission. Since the operating Vcc range for the XBee-PRO is 3000-4000 mV, after scaling by 1024/1200, the useful range for this parameter is 0,0x0a00-0x0b55.

string-array.name: xbee_io_settings_ranges
string-array.item: 0 - Disabled,1 - Commissioning button,2 - ADC,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - N/A,2 - ADC,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - N/A,2 - ADC,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - N/A,2 - ADC,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - N/A,2 - N/A,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - Associated indicator,2 - N/A,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - RSSI PWM output,2 - N/A,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - N/A,2 - N/A,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Disabled,1 - N/A,2 - N/A,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high

string-array.name: xbee_networking_descriptions
string-array.item:
Range: 0x0 - 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF (Default: 0)

Set the PAN (Personal Area Network) ID for the network (ZigBee extended PAN ID).
Valid range is 0 - 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF.
Alternatively, set ID=0 (default) for the coordinator to choose a random Pan ID.

Range: 0x1 - 0x7FFF (Default: 3FFF)

Set/read list of channels to scan (active and energy scans) when forming a PAN as bitfield.
Scans are initiated during coordinator startup: Bit 15 = Chan 0x1A… Bit0 = Chan 0x0B

Range: 0x0 - 0x07 (Default: 3)

Set/read the Scan Duration exponent.
The exponent configures the duration of the active scan and energy scan during coordinator initialization.
Scan Time = SC × (2 ^ SD) × 15.36ms. (SC=# channels)

Range: 0x0 - 0x2 (Default: 0)

Set/read the ZigBee stack profile setting.
0 = Network Specific
1 = ZigBee-2006
2 = ZigBee-PRO

Range: 0x0 - 0xFF (Default: FF)

Set/read the Node Join time.
The value of NJ determines the time (in seconds) that the device will allow other devices to join to it. If set to 0xFF, the device will always allow joining.

Range: 0x0 - 0x64FF (Default: 0)

Set/read the network watchdog timeout.
If set to a non-zero value, the network watchdog timer is enabled on a router. The router will leave the network if is does not receive valid communication within (3 × NW) minutes. The timer is reset each time data is received from or sent to a coordinator, or if a many-to-one broadcast is received.

Default: 0

Set/read the channel verification setting.
If enabled, a router will verify a coordinator exists on the same channel after joining or power cycling to ensure it is operating on a valid channel, and will leave if a coordinator cannot be found (if NJ=0xFF). If disabled, the router will remain on the same cahnnel through power cycles.

Default: 0

Set/read the join notification setting.
If enabled, the module will transmit a broadcast node identification frame on power up and when joining. This action blinks the Assoc LED rapidly on all devices that receive the data, and sends an API frame out the UART of API devices. This function should be disabled for large newworks.
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead the operating PAN ID (ZigBee extended PAN ID).
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead the 16-bit operating PAN ID.
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead the operating channel number (Uses 802.15.4 channel numbers).

Read-only parameter.

Read the number of remaining end device children that can join this device..
If NC=0, the device cannot allow any more end device children to join.

string-array.name: xbee_rf_interfacing_descriptions
string-array.item:
Default: 4

Select/Read transmitter output power. Power levels relative to PP:
0 = -8dB
1 = -6dB
2 = -4dB
3 = -2dB
4 = 0dB

Default: 1

Select/Read module boost mode setting.
If enabled, boost mode improves sensitivity by 1dB and increases output power by 2dB, improving the link margin and range.
Read-only parameter.\n\nRead dBm output when PL4 is selected.

string-array.name: xbee_rf_interfacing_ranges
string-array.item: 0 - Boost mode disabled,1 - Boost mode enabled

string-array.name: xbee_security_descriptions
string-array.item:
Range: 0x0 - 0x1 (Default: 0)

Set the ZigBee Encryption options :
Bit0 = Acquire / Transmit network security key unencrypted during joining.

0 - 32 hexadecimal characters (Default: '')

Sets key used for encryption and decryption (ZigBee trust center link key).
This register can not be read.

string-array.name: xbee_serial_interfacing_descriptions
string-array.item:
Default: 3

Set/read the serial interface baud rate for communication between modem serial port and host.
Request non-standard baud rates above 0x12C using a terminal window. Read BD register to find actual baud rate achieved.

Default: 0

Configure the number of stop bits for the UART.
This setting is only valid for no parity, even parity, or odd parity.

Default: 1

Configure options for the DIO7 line of the module.
Options include: CTS flow control, Digital Input and Output, or RS-485 enable control.

Default: 0

Configure options for the DIO6 line of the module.
Options include: RTS flow control, and Digital Input and Output.

Default: 0

Set the API output mode register value.
0 - Received Data formatted as native API frame format
1 - Received RF data formatted as Explicit Rx-Indicator
3 - Same as 1, plus received ZDO requests are passed out the UART

string-array.name: xbee_serial_interfacing_ranges
string-array.item: 0 - No parity,1 - Even parity,2 - Odd parity,3 - Mark parity
0 - One stop bit,1 - Two stop bits
0 - Disable,1 - CTS flow control,2 - N/A,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high,6 - RS-485 enable low,7 - RS-485 enable high
0 - Disable,1 - RTS flow control,2 - N/A,3 - Digital input,4 - Digital out low,5 - Digital out high
0 - Native,1 - Explicit,2 - Reserved,3 - Explicit with ZDO pass-through

string-array.name: xbee_sleep_modes_descriptions
string-array.item: Default: 0\n\nSet/read sleep mode: Pin Hibernate is lowest power, Cyclic Sleep wakes on timer expiration, Cyclic Sleep Pin-Wake wakes on timer expiration or when Sleep_Rq (module pin 9) transitions from a high to a low state. If SM is set to 0, the XBee is a router, otherwise it is an end device.

Range: 0x1 - 0xFFFF (Default: 1)

Set/read the number of cyclic sleep periods used to calculate end device poll timeout.
If an end device does not send a poll request to its parent coordinator or router within the poll timeout, the end device is removed from the child table.
The poll timeout is calculated in milliseconds as (3 × SN × (SP × 10ms)), minimum of 5 seconds. i.e. if SN=15, SP=0x64, the timeout is 45 seconds.

Range: 0x0 - 0xFF (Default: 0)

Set/read sleep options. Bitfield options include :
0x02 - Wake for ST time on each cyclic wake (after sleeping for SN sleep periods)
0x04 - Enable extended cyclic sleep (sleep for entire SN×SP time - possible data loss)
All other option bits should be set to 0.

Range: 0x20 - 0xAF0 (Default: 20)

Set/read Cyclic sleep period for cyclic sleeping remotes.
Set SP on parent (Coordinator or Router) to match the largest SP of its end device children.
On a router or coordinator, SP determines the transmission timeout when sending to a sleeping end device. SP also determines how long the parent will buffer a message for a sleeping child.

Range: 0x1 - 0xFFFE (Default: 1388)\n\nSet/read time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before activating Sleep Mode. The ST parameter is used only with Cyclic Sleep settings (SM=4-5).

Range: 0x0 - 0x3E8 (Default: 0)

Set/read the poll rate in 10 msec units when set as a sleepy end device.
Setting this to 0 (default) enables polling at 100ms (default rate). Adaptive polling may allow the end device to poll more rapidly for a short time when receiving RF data.

string-array.name: xbee_sleep_modes_ranges
string-array.item: 0 - No sleep (router),1 - PIN Hibernate,2 - Reserved,3 - Reserved,4 - Cyclic sleep,5 - Cyclic sleep PIN-Wake

resources.string: XBee node is not ready for discovery.
Failed to load XBee radio configuration.
When a device connects to a ZigBee network it gets a 16-bit Network address.

Each device(node) has a 64-Bit Device address. In XBee ZB modules, this 64-bit address is a unique permanent number assigned by the manufacturer. This is also the serial number of the device. Any data sent from one ZigBee device to another is sent by specifying the 16-bit Network Address and the 64-bit Device Address.
The node discovery allows to discover the XBee nodes present in the local XBee node\'s PAN.
To do this, go to [icon] XBee nodes window and click the [fab] button.
ZigBee is a standard for low-power, short range wireless devices based on an IEEE 802 standard for personal area networks (PAN).
A ZED must join PAN like a router before sending any senor data. A ZED requires the least amount of memory, and therefore can be less expensive to manufacture than a ZR or ZC.
A ZigBee network consist of three different types of ZigBee devices: coordinator, router, end-device. Each network has a 16bit PAN ID. All devices in a ZigBee network is assigned a single PAN ID.

The most capable device, the coordinator forms the root of the network tree and might bridge to other networks. There must be one ZigBee coordinator in each network since it is the device that starts the net work originally.

The coordinator initiates a Personal Area Network (PAN) by selecting a RF channel and PAN ID. ZC also allows routers and end-devices to join the PAN. It is able to store information about the network, including acting as the Trust Center & repository for security keys.

As well as running an application function, a router can act as an intermediate router, passing on data from other devices. A router can start operation only when it has establishes connection with ZC.

Contains just enough functionality to talk to the parent node (either the coordinator or a router); it cannot relay data from other devices. This relationship allows the node to be asleep a significant amount of the time thereby giving long battery life.
Allows the app to use XBee radio module for ZigBee communication.
Restore selected XBee to factory defaults ?\nThis cannot be undone.
Not use this USB device as XBee device.
Use the USB device as an XBee device.
XBee is a wireless communication module that Digi built to the 802.15.4/ZigBee standard. The ZigBee wireless standard can form self-healing mesh networks.
